intro: Moraea brevituba, commonly known as the short-tubed moraea, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its compact, bulbous structure. The plant produces striking, showy flowers in shades of white, pink, and purple, often with intricate patterns. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
